channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024100324
item.description:
Report E-2024100324

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: EUCLID
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 11000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 10, 2024, at 1154 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Euclid, OH regarding the release of Paraformaldehyde Prills 91-93%. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 150 lbs of Paraformaldehyde Prills 91-93% (UN2213, 4.1, III) from (3) bags onto the trailer floor. The release was reportedly due to impact from pallets during loading, affecting multiple areas in the trailer. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The contractors collected the release with the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DF, which were then taken off site by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100303
item.description:
Report E-2024100303

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 1, 2024, six (6) one-gallon pails of paint were damaged by a forklift and released approximately four (4) gallons of paint to the trailer interior, dock floor, and pavement. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1263-impacted trailer, dock, and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and four (4) 1-gallon pails of UN1263 were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100288
item.description:
Report E-2024100288

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 2, 2024, two (2) 1.5 gallon jugs of hydrogen peroxide were damaged by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized absorbents, cleaners, and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum and three (3) 35-gallon drums to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100221
item.description:
Report E-2024100221

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: FINDLAY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 30, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3082 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 85-gallon overpack. FCE personnel utilized absorbents to remediate the site. All absorbents and deconstructed pallets were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.
